section.title: What Are Coordinates
section.para: In this platform, coordinates are structured filters and settings used to control:

listitem.para: What data is shown
How it is displayed
How relationships are inferred or navigated
Which version or state of a concept is visible

section.para: They are essential for the system’s logic and UI panels (search, navigator, reasoner, etc.).

section.title: Types of Coordinates and Their Purpose

table.title: Types of Coordinates and Their Purpose

row.entry: Stamp Coordinate
Filters by path, time, status (active/inactive), author, and module
All panels (search, navigator, details, reasoner)
Language Coordinate
Controls which description (synonym/FQN), dialect, and language to show
All panels (where text is shown)
Navigation Coordinate
Controls hierarchy view logic—what “parent/child” relationships to use
Concept Navigator only
Logic Coordinate
Defines logical interpretation (used by reasoner)
Reasoner only

section.title: View Coordinate vs Edit Coordinate

row.entry: View Coordinate
A container object that holds the stamp, logic, navigation, and language coordinates for a window.
Edit Coordinate
Used for setting default values when editing (e.g., author = Doug). Mainly used in backend logic.

section.para: Every window or panel has its own View Coordinate. These are not shared globally.
Orange highlight in the UI = panel has overridden the master view coordinate setting.

section.title: Stamp Coordinate: Deep Dive

listitem.para: Path: (Primordial, Sandbox, Development, Master)
Status: Active, Inactive, or Both
Time Position: Used for time-based filtering
Module: Included/Excluded modules (often buggy or unstable)

section.para: Each path is treated like a branch:
If you set your filter to Development, you will see:

listitem.para: Concepts on Development
Concepts on paths it originated from (Sandbox, Primordial)

section.para: If two versions of a semantic exist:

listitem.para: One on Development path, timestamp T1
One on Sandbox path, timestamp T2 (newer)

section.para: If stamp filter is set to Development, it will prefer the Development version, even if it’s older—path precedence overrides time.

listitem.para: Determines:
Language (e.g., English, Spanish)
Preferred term type (synonym vs fully qualified name)
Dialect (US vs GB)
Used everywhere a concept label is displayed.
If no translation exists in selected language → displays negative ID or fallback.
Filter can be tested by changing language and term preferences in the Concept Navigator.
Multiple semantics with different languages/dialects were created for testing in the test dataset (TinkerExampleData 1.2.16 link below).

section.title: Navigation Coordinate

listitem.para: Only relevant in the Concept Navigator panel
Switches between:
Stated relationships (authored)
Inferred relationships (from reasoner)

section.para: Used to define how parent/child links appear in the hierarchy.

listitem.para: Used only by the reasoner to determine how to process logical definitions.
Currently supports:
ELK reasoner
Previously: SnowRocket (deprecated)
Not interactive in the current UI.
Logic Coordinate options are set but not functionally changeable.
Present mainly because it is part of the View Coordinate container.

section.title: Master Coordinate Menu & Override Logic

listitem.para: Master coordinate = default for all panels
Panels can override it (manually or programmatically)
Orange indicator = override
Use “Remove Overrides” to reset
